timeline.message: Changed repo description since migration directory contains other databases besides Teradata
The function parses Redshift interval literal and converts it to seconds

Added binary/hex conversions

Added functions to convert an integer number to/from binary/hex form

timeline.author: ryanmcdowell
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,30 @@
+  
+/*
+ * Copyright 2020 Google LLC
+ *
+ * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
+ * you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
+ * You may obtain a copy of the License at
+ *
+ *     http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
+ *
+ * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
+ * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
+ * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
+ * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
+ * limitations under the License.
+ */
+
+-- from_binary:
+-- Input: STRING representing a number in binary form
+-- Output: INT64 number in decimal form
+CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION fn.from_binary(s STRING) AS 
+(
+  (
+    SELECT 
+      SUM(
+      	CAST(c AS INT64) << (LENGTH(s) - 1 - bit))
+    FROM 
+      UNNEST(SPLIT(s, '')) AS c WITH OFFSET bit
+  )
+);

replies.bodyText: Where to add a trailing newline? I don't see any issues with formatting.
replies.author: epishova

replies.bodyText: The file should end with a newline character. I believe GitHub is calling this out with the red symbol at the end of line 30.
replies.author: ryanmcdowell

timeline.bodyText: Seems like this would all fit on one line

timeline.author: ryanmcdowell
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,35 @@
+  
+/*
+ * Copyright 2020 Google LLC
+ *
+ * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
+ * you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
+ * You may obtain a copy of the License at
+ *
+ *     http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
+ *
+ * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
+ * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
+ * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
+ * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
+ * limitations under the License.
+ */
+
+-- from_hex:
+-- Input: STRING representing a number in hexadecimal form
+-- Output: INT64 number in decimal form
+CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION fn.from_hex(s STRING) AS 
+(
+  (
+    SELECT 
+      SUM(
+      	CAST(
+      	  CONCAT(
+      	  	'0x', 
+      	  	SUBSTR(
+      	  	  s, 
+      	  	  byte * 2 + 1, 2)) 
+      	  AS INT64) << ((LENGTH(s) - (byte + 1) * 2) * 4))
+   FROM UNNEST(GENERATE_ARRAY(1, LENGTH(s) / 2)) WITH OFFSET byte
+  )
+);

replies.bodyText: Where to add a trailing newline?

timeline.author: ryanmcdowell
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -293,4 +293,19 @@ percentage_difference:
   - test:
     input: CAST(1.0 AS FLOAT64), CAST(1000000000 AS INT64)
     expected_output: CAST(2.0 AS FLOAT64)
- 
+to_binary:
+  - test:
+    input: CAST(123456 AS INT64)
+    expected_output: CAST('0000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000011110001001000000' AS STRING)
+from_binary:
+  - test:
+    input: CAST('0000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000011110001001000000' AS STRING)
+    expected_output: CAST(123456 AS INT64)
+to_hex:
+  - test:
+    input: CAST(123456 AS INT64)
+    expected_output: CAST('000000000001e240' AS STRING)
+from_hex:
+  - test:
+    input: CAST('000000000001e240' AS STRING)
+    expected_output: CAST(123456 AS INT64)

timeline.bodyText: What happens when input is NULL?

-

timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,31 @@
+  
+/*
+ * Copyright 2020 Google LLC
+ *
+ * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
+ * you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
+ * You may obtain a copy of the License at
+ *
+ *     http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
+ *
+ * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
+ * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
+ * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
+ * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
+ * limitations under the License.
+ */
+
+-- to_binary:
+-- Input: INT64 number
+-- Output: STRING representing the input number in binary form
+CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION fn.to_binary(x INT64) AS 
+(
+  (
+    SELECT 
+      STRING_AGG(
+        CAST(x >> bit & 0x1 AS STRING), 
+        '' ORDER BY bit DESC)
+    FROM 
+      UNNEST(GENERATE_ARRAY(0, 63)) AS bit
+  )
+);

@@ -0,0 +1,33 @@
+  
+/*
+ * Copyright 2020 Google LLC
+ *
+ * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
+ * you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
+ * You may obtain a copy of the License at
+ *

+ *
+ * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
+ * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
+ * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
+ * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
+ * limitations under the License.
+ */
+
+-- to_hex:
+-- Input: INT64 number
+-- Output: STRING representing the input number in hexadecimal form
+CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION fn.to_hex(x INT64) AS 
+(
+  (
+    SELECT 
+      STRING_AGG(
+        FORMAT(
+          '%02x', 
+          x >> (byte * 8) & 0xff), 
+        '' ORDER BY byte DESC)
+    FROM 
+      UNNEST(GENERATE_ARRAY(0, 7)) AS byte
+  )
+);
